result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------

Maintain full time employment, full time school, or a combination of the two.
---------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with any of the co-defendants or with CI-1118. No contact with any of the victims Afrim Lika, Asime Lika, Atlije Fejza, Mrgim Fejza, or Ramiz Fejza, their business or their residences.
---------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------
*AMENDMENT 11/8/2017 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect one DNA surcharge of $250.00.
----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended counseling or programming.
---------------------------

Restitution is held open for sixty (60) days and is subject to the defendant's right to challenge and request a restitution hearing in accordance with local court rules.
---------------------------
**NOTE: Restitution request was filed on September 14, 2017 in the amount of $3,888.04 Joint and Several with co-actors: Drevon A. Grant; 15CF41; Jacob A. Curler, 15CF96; Michael R. Kraft, 15CF52
---------------------------

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED

10:40 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jeremy L. Thomas in court with Atty Donna Kuchler.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing hearing.  
Court makes record as to charges.  A PSI was prepared & filed by DOC.  
Court believes there is an error in PSI with regard to eligibility for SAP.  
Court has reviewed the file and reports that have been filed.  
Atty Johnson makes record as to compliance with victim's rights.  
There is no request for restitution.  
Atty Kuchler has no corrections to the PSI.  
10:43 am  Statement by Jenine Zrna, mother of defendant.  
10:45 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
10:53 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Kuchler.  
11:12 am  Statement by defendant.  
11:15 am  Response by defendant to Court's questions.  
11:17 am  Court takes 10 minute recess.  
11:31 am  Court in session.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Ct 1:  Total length of sentence is 15 yrs; 8 yrs IC & 7 yrs ES;  
Ct 2:  Total length of sentence is 8 yrs; 5 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES, conc. with Ct 1;  
Ct 3:  Total length of sentence is 3 yrs; 2 yrs IC & 1 yr ES, conc. with Ct 1;  
Ct 4:  Total length of sentence is 2 yrs & 6 mths; 18 mths IC & 1 yr ES, conc. with Ct 1;  
922 days of sentence credit (2/27/2015 to 09/06/2017);  
NOT eligible for CIP or SAP;  
CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended counseling or programming.  
2)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
3)  No weapons.   
4)  No contact with any of the co-defendants or with CI-1118.  
5)  No contact with any of the victims Afrim Lika, Asime Lika, Atlije Fejza, Mrgim Fejza or Ramiz Fejza, their business or their residences.  
7)  Pay court costs.  
8)  Restitution is held open for 60 days and is subject to the defendant's right to challenge and request a restitution hearing in accordance with local court rules.  
9)  Maintain full time employment, full time school or a combination of the two.  
10)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

Court warns deft:  1) May not vote until civil rights are restored; 2)  May not possess firearms;  3)  May not possess body armor.  11:54 am  Court in recess.

Albanian Interpreters:  Edlira Sula and Shqiprim Xheladini;  
BAILIFFS:  Bob Nitka, Diane Mullins and Nancy Lyon;  
8:33 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jeremy L. Thomas in court, with Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  
Court makes record as to curative instruction prepared by the Court with regard to defendant being in custody.  No objection by Attys to proposed Instruction.  Court will read after 160 and before instruction 170.  Continued discussion concerning jury instructions to be prepared by the State.  Atty Johnson provides Court with Instruction 246; Atty Kuchler has prepared Instruction, re:  CI1118;  Court indicates last sentence should not be included because it does not apply.  Attys are in agreement.  Discussion concerning witnesses being called by defense this morning.  Atty Kuchler will be calling Drevon Grant adversely.  Response by Atty Johnson.  Court that will need to be shown more before the Court will declare him adverse or hostile to the defense. 8:45 am  Court in recess.  
9:00 am  Court in session with Attys and defendant.  
9:00 am  Jury seated in courtroom.

9:14 am  Redirect by Atty Kuchler.

9:17 am  Jury excused from courtroom.  
9:17 am  Atty Johnson makes record with regard to next witness to be called by defense.  Atty Johnson was not provided for DOB.  Atty Kuchler provided it to Atty Johnson today.  Court asks that Atty Kuchler call another witness at this time.

9:22 am  Jury returns to courtroom.  
9:23 am  Helen Thomas is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Kuchler.  
9:28 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
9:30 am  Witness excused.  
9:32 am  Willie Thomas is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Kuchler.  
Exhibit marked, identified, offered & received:  84;  
9:48 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
9:57 am  No redirect.  Witness excused.  
9:58 am  Det. Craig Konopski is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Kuchler.  
10:01 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
10:03 am  Redirect by Atty Kuchler.  
10:04 am  Witness excused.  
10:04 am  Drevon Grant is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Kuchler.  
10:06 am  Objection by Atty Johnson.  Jury excused from courtroom.  
10:07 am  Argument by Atty Johnson.  Response by Atty Kuchler.  
10:08 am  Court asks for more information concerning these photo arrays.  
10:09 am  Response by Attorneys.  
10:12 am  Court now understands the relevance and Court will overrule the State's objection.  
10:12 am  Court in recess for a short break.  
10:19 am  Court in session with Defendant and Attys.  Mr. Grant asked during the break if he could speak with an attorney.  He says he does have an attorney.  Attys advised Mr. Grant that they are not able to give him any legal advice.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Grant.  Court advises Mr. Grant that he is entitled to speak with his Attorney.  Attorney Henderson is called from the Courtroom by Clerk.  All parties, except court security, vacate courtroom so that Mr. Grant may speak with Attorney Henderson via telephone.  

10:31 am  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Grant.  
10:33 am  Jury seated in Courtroom.  Court overruled objection.  
10:33 am  Continued direct exam of Mr. Grant by Atty Kuchler.  
10:38 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
10:41 am  Redirect by Atty Kuchler.  
10:43 am  No further cross.  Witness excused.  
10:43 am  Jury excused from courtroom. 

10:44 am  Atty Kuchler has only 1 more potential witness - her client.  She needs to speak with him first before advising whether or not he will testify.  
10:45 am  Court in recess.  
10:58 am  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  
10:58 am  Response by Atty Kuchler to Court's question.  Mr. Thomas does wish to testify. 
10:58 am  Court has colloquy with Mr. Thomas with regard to this decision to testify.  
10:59 am  Defendant is choosing to testify.  Response by Atty Kuchler to Court's questions.  Court makes findings with regard to defendant's decision to testify.  
10:59 am  Court takes short recess.  

11:06 am  Court in session.  Court has brief colloquy with defendant.  
11:06 am  Jury returns to courtroom.  
11:07 am  Jeremy Thomas is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Kuchler.  
11:44 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
11:50 am  Redirect by Atty Kuchler.  
11:50 am  Witness excused.  
11:51 am  Defense rests.  State has 1 rebuttal witness.  
11:52 am  Jurors excused for lunch and asked to return at 1:00 pm
11:53 am  Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Court asks Attys to report back in court at 12:40 pm.  
11:54 am  Court in recess.  

12:46 pm  Court in session with Attorneys and Defendant.  
12:50 pm  Discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to Jury Instructions.  
1:04 pm  Atty Johnson plans on recalling CI1118.  Discussion re:  adopted admissions.  Atty Johnson makes offer of proof with regard to the statements made by Drevon Grant during his conversation with CI1118.  Atty Kuchler objects to ADA Johnson recalling CI1118 as a witness.  1:10 pm  Response by Atty Johnson.  Response by Atty Kuchler.  Court believes it is proper rebuttal territory with CI1118 and makes further record with regard to the testimony.  Court believes it would be rebuttal testimony.  Court makes findings and will allow that testimony to come in.  

1:15 pm  Jury seated in Courtroom.  
1:15 pm  REBUTTAL:  State recalls CI1118.

1:24 pm  Witness excused.  
1:24 pm  Evidence is closed.  
1:26 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Court in recess.  
1:46 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Court has provided Attys with Jury Instruction for their review.  
1:48 pm  Jurors are seated in courtroom.  
1:48 pm  Court Instructs the Jurors.  

2;26 pm  Closing argument by Atty Johnson.  
3:09 pm  Closing argument by Atty Kuchler.  
3:54 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
3:55 pm  No objection by Attys to the Instructions as read by the Court.  Court takes recess.      

4:02 pm  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Jurors seated in Courtroom.  
4:03 pm  Rebuttal argument by Atty Johnson.
4:13 pm  Court further Instructs the Jury.  
4:17 pm  Alternate Jurors are named:  2312 and 2367; 
4:17 pm  Clerk gives Oath to Bailiffs.  
4:17 pm  Jurors excused to begin deliberations
4:18 pm  No objection by Attys to instructions as read by the Court.  
4:19 pm  Court in recess.  

6:01 pm  Court in session with Attorneys and defendant.  Jurors have 3 questions.  Court believes response to first 2 questions should be that they have to rely on their collective memories and their notes.  As to question #3, the jury wishes to see video of interrogation of Drevon. Atty Johnson is in agreement with their request.  Atty Kuchler believes they should rely on their notes and memories.  Court notes they are requesting to see an actual exhibit and believes they are entitled to view it.  6:05 pm  Atty Johnson will set up video and then Jurors will be brought into courtroom when they are ready.  

6:16 pm  Court in session with Attorneys and Deft.  
6:16 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  Jurors have requested to see video of interrogation of Drevon Grant by Det. Recknagel.  
6:17 pm  Portions of video are played for Jurors.  
6:20 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
6:21 pm  Court in recess.  

9:28 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Court explains that if either side is requesting the Jurors be polled, the Court will use their Juror # and not refer to them by name.  
9:30 pm  Jurors seated in Courtroom.  
9:31 pm  Court reads verdicts.  Defendant found guilty of Cts 1, 2, 3, 4.  
9:33 pm  Atty Kuchler requests the Jurors be polled.  Court polls Jurors.  
9:35 pm  Jurors are excused.  
9:35 pm  Attorney Johnson asks that the Court accept the jury's verdict and enter judgment of conviction; Atty Kuchler asks for judgment of acquittal not withstanding the verdict; Court believes there is evidence which supports the verdicts and enters judgment of conviction on each count.  Court orders a PSI.  State asks that defendant's bond be revoked; Atty Kuchler asks that defendant be released on bond pending sentencing.  Court makes record and revokes defendant's bond.  
SENTENCING HEARING SCHEDULED for September 9, 2017 at 9:00 am (2  hours reserved)
9:40 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 11/21/2017: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**

5:08 pm  Court in session with Attys Johnson and Kuchler and the Defendant.  
5:09 pm  Atty Kuchler moves for a directed verdict.  Argument by Atty Kuchler.  
5:12 pm  Argument by Atty Johnson.  
5:16 pm  Court makes record.  Court notes that the defense is not challenging that these crimes occurred to this family.  There is ample and strong credible evidence in the record to show that these crimes were committed.  The question is whether or not this defendant was involved.  Court makes findings and denies Defendant's Motion for a directed verdict.  
5:27 pm  Court next wishes to have a jury instruction conference with the Attorneys.  
Court makes further record as to basis for sustaining the State's objection with regard to the photo arrays.  
Court will first go through State's proposed jury instructions; then the substantive instructions and the Defense proposed jury instructions;  
Atty Kuchler is in agreement with substantive instructions provided by State with a minor typo correction.  
Court next deals with Instructions 245-246;  State is objecting.  Argument by Atty Kuchler.  Atty Johnson believes that Jury Instruction 300 covers this topic.  Court makes record that Instruction 300 does cover and denies request for prooffered defense instruction #1; Argument by Atty Kuchler with regard to proposed defense instruction #2; Argument by Atty Johnson; Response by Atty Kuchler.  Same reasoning Court made with regard to proposed instruction #1 applies to proposed instruction #2;  Court believes Instruction 300 completely applies here.  Court denies defense instruction #2; Atty Kuchler makes record with regard to proposed Defense Instruction #3; Argument by Atty Johnson; Court notes we have instructions 245, 246 and there is not a standard instruction with regard to confidential informants.  Court's concern is how defense instruction #3 is worded.  Court believes that for the most part it is covered by 300 but if defense wants to craft an alternative instruction with regard to the C.I. which is like 245, then the Court would read that instruction.  Court next deals with defense proposed instruction 6.  Discussion between Attorneys and Court.  Court doesn't see a necessity for the Instruction and the defense can make an argument on it to the jury.  Court addresses Instruction 246 with the Attys.  Court believes it is appropriate with regard to Michael Kraft.  Atty Johnson wishes to add to Instruction 1480 and add Mrgim Fejza.  Atty Kuchler has no objection.  Atty Kuchler argues that there should be an Instruction 246 given for both Michael Kraft and for CI1118.  Atty Johnson would like to review the comments on the instruction.  Court is going to agree with the defense after reviewing the comments to the Instruction.  Court will agree with the Defense and asks State to prepare Instruction 246 in line with the Court's direction.  6:12 pm  Court in recess.

4th Omnibus Motion and Demand for Immediate Hearing

3:32 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jeremy L. Thomas in court, in custody with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  
Matter is before the Court on several Omnibus Motions to compel discovery filed by the Defense .  Court saw State's response to the first Motion.  Court asks if any of these issues are outstanding?  Court starts with Omnibus Motion #1 - request for photo arrays and CI files.  Atty Johnson advised that CI 1115 is deceased.  Response by Atty Kuchler that she believes that whatever is in his file could be relevant.  3:35 pm  Response by Atty Johnson.  She does not believe the defense is entitled to the information in their files.  She is required to provide exculpatory information.  There is quite a bit of information in the police reports.  There was no consideration for their cooperation.  3:36 pm  Response by Atty Kuchler.  Atty Kuchler said there was a probation hold of one of the CI's that was lifted as a result of his cooperation.  She believes there was a contract.  Court is wondering why information with regard to CI 1115 would be discoverable at all if he or she is deceased.  Court asks for any case or statute that contradicts Sec. 905.10?  Atty Kuchler indicates that she does not.  She doesn't believe Officers should be allowed to testify at trial as to anything they learned from CI 1115.  Response by Atty Johnson.  Response by Court.  Atty Kuchler is looking for the contract.  3:43 pm  Court makes record and denies motion for disclosure of information of CI 1115.  The State cannot try to backdoor in through officers as to what information CI 1115 provided - cannot use in case in chief until the door is opened by the defense.  Court address Motion with regard to CI 1118.  Argument by Atty Kuchler.  Response by Atty Johnson that she does believe it is discoverable except she does not want any personal information disclosed.  3:47 pm  Court makes record.  Under 904.01 Court believes it is relevant and under Sec. 904.03 it would potentially be admissible.  Court definitely believes it is discoveryable.  Any contracts or any memorandums of understanding or that the officer had know ledge of that these 2 individiaul or given or negaa needs to be given over to the defense.  Any personal information would not be relevant and coudl be removed or redacted.  3:50 pm  This can be provided by the State to Atty Kuchler by April 12th.  The other issue is a request for a duplicate copy of the photo array.  Response by Atty Kuchler that she would like the photo arrays for each time they were given and in the manner in which they were displayed.  Discussion between Court and Attys with regard to the various photo arrays.  Atty Johnson will provide Atty Kuchler with the other photo arrays.  Motions in Limine will be addressed at the time of the final pre-trial.  4:03 pm  Court in recess.
